original_title: Sri Lanka hikes entry fees to botanical gardens
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has hiked entry fees to botanical gardens by tourists and domestic visitors by around 50 percent from July 01, amid spike in inflation from the collapse of a flexible exchange rate.

Adult tourists will be charged 3000 rupees, up from the previous 2,000 rupees and children below 12 would be charged 1,500 rupees up from the previous 1,000, according gazette issued by Tourism Minister Harin Fernando.
Foreign university students will be charged 2,000 rupees, up from 1,200 upon producing proof.
Domestic adult visitors would be charged 200 rupees, up from 100 earlier.
Children below 12 years would be charged 30 rupees and senior citizens above 60 years would be charged 50 rupees. (Colombo/May23/2023)
